p: Sesquiterpene hydrocarbons were the main group of essential oil constituents of S. salviifolia and S. palustris sample from Croatia, with germacrene D being the main constituent of S. salviifolia, in contrast to S. palustris, which contained a significant aldehyde fraction and a high amount of alcohols [ 1]. The essential oil from the aerial parts of S. palustris from both samples from Italy was characterised mainly by carbonylic compounds, fatty acids, and their esters, along with sesquiterpenoidic compounds and phenols [ 23, 24].
